entries.meaning: (baseball) A pitch of a baseball that has been partly covered with saliva, illegal at most levels.
A balled-up piece of paper, moistened with saliva (by chewing) and shot through a drinking straw.

verbs.description: spitball (third-person singular simple present spitballs, present participle spitballing, simple past and past participle spitballed)

entries.meaning: (baseball) To moisten the ball with saliva before pitching it.

examples: Maybe, and I'm just spitballing here, maybe, we have a responsibility as officers to train Santiago.
